Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Koala \Ko*a"la\, n. A tailless furry marsupial ({Phascolarctos cinereus}), found in Australia. The female carries her young on the back of her neck. Called also {Australian bear}, {koala bear}, {native bear}, and {native sloth}. The koala lives almost all of its life in trees, moves sluggishly like a sloth, and eats eucalyptus leaves almost exclusively. [1913 Webster +PJC]

koala n : sluggish tailless Australian arboreal marsupial with gray furry ears and coat; feeds on eucalyptus leaves and bark [syn: {koala bear}, {kangaroo bear}, {native bear}, {Phascolarctos cinereus}]
